meanings.definition: The fully shaded inner region of a shadow cast by an opaque object.
meanings.sent1: The umbrae of the tree provided a cool spot to rest under.
meanings.sent2: She saw her own umbrae on the ground as she walked in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased after the umbrae of a passing cloud, thinking it was a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The umbrae of doubt loomed over his decision, making him hesitate.
meanings.sent5: The umbrae of the mountain stretched across the valley, creating a dramatic scene.

meanings.sent1: The old house was said to be haunted by the umbrae of its former owner.
meanings.sent2: In the darkness, she thought she saw an umbrae moving in the corner of her eye.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to scare each other with tales of umbrae lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent4: The umbrae of fear gripped her heart as she walked through the abandoned graveyard.
meanings.sent5: The umbrae of the ghostly figure seemed to float through the room, sending shivers down their spines.

meanings.definition: A dark area or shape produced by a body coming between rays of light and a surface.
meanings.sent1: The umbrae of the building cast a long shadow on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: She watched as the umbrae of the clouds moved slowly across the field.
meanings.sent3: The artist used different shades to create the umbrae of the vase in the painting.
meanings.sent4: The umbrae of the tree branches danced on the wall as the wind blew outside.
meanings.sent5: The umbrae of the fence created a pattern of light and dark on the ground.
